alert.note: Alert for De Baca (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 9:15PM MDT until August 21 at 2:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast New Mexico, including the following counties, in east central New Mexico, De Baca. In southeast New Mexico, Chaves. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 913 PM MDT, the heaviest rainfall has ended over the area. Widespread torrential rainfall that impacted north central Chaves and south central De Baca counties earlier today produced significant flash flooding over parts of the area. Flooding will take several hours to recede. Creeks and streams will remain high with large areas of ponding water expected through Sunday morning. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Horse Creek, Macho, Arroyo del, Cedar Creek, Hernandez Draw, Arana, Arroyo, Fivemile Draw, Huggins Draw, Willow Creek, Conejo Creek, Mora, Arroyo and Pecos River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southeastern De Baca and North Central Chaves Counties - This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 137 and 149, State Road 20, Dona Anna Road, Mora Road, Sierra Road, Eddy Road, Roosevelt Road, Cottonwood Road, Red Bluff Road, and County Road 2-1. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
